title.zh: 引力波「聽」到了中子星合併後的新生黑洞在「鳴響」
title.en: Gravitational Waves 'Hear' a Newborn Black Hole Ringing After Neutron Star Merger

summary.zh:
當兩顆中子星在宇宙深處猛烈碰撞、合併成一個新生黑洞時，這個剛剛誕生的天體並不「安靜」——它會像一口被敲響的大鐘那樣振盪，向外輻射特定頻率的引力波。這種訊號在廣義相對論中被稱為「準正則模」（quasinormal modes），是驗證黑洞無毛定理的關鍵證據。

本期 Nature 封面報導了 LIGO-Virgo-KAGRA 聯合團隊的一項突破：他們在引力波事件 GW230529 的資料中首次清晰地偵測到了合併後「鳴響」階段的訊號。分析表明，這一訊號與廣義相對論的預測高度吻合。這是人類首次直接聆聽到新生黑洞振盪的「餘音」，為黑洞物理和強引力場檢驗開啟了全新窗口。
summary.en:
When two neutron stars collide and merge into a newborn black hole deep in space, the freshly formed object doesn't settle quietly. It rings like a struck bell, radiating gravitational waves at specific frequencies. These signals, known as 'quasinormal modes' in general relativity, are a key test of the no-hair theorem — the idea that black holes are fully described by just mass and spin.

This week's Nature cover reports a breakthrough from the LIGO-Virgo-KAGRA collaboration: in gravitational-wave event GW230529, the team has detected, for the first time with high confidence, the post-merger 'ringdown' signal. The measured frequencies match general relativity's predictions with striking precision. It marks the first time scientists have directly listened to the reverberating afterglow of a newborn black hole — opening an entirely new window onto black-hole physics and strong-field gravity.

keyArticle.title: Detection of quasinormal modes from a neutron star merger remnant
